subject: Re: Naming Test classes, was:Re: [junit] Test Variants
msgSnippet: Simply choose descriptive names. Why wouldn t that be enough to find the tests? If you had to name the test RIGHT NOW, what would you name it? Perhaps that
messageBody:
Simply choose descriptive names. Why wouldn't that be enough to find
the tests? If you had to name the test RIGHT NOW, what would you name
it? Perhaps that name is good enough.

*********** REPLY SEPARATOR ***********

On 2002-07-04 at 10:21 Johannes Link wrote:

>> Strong suggestion: place these tests in their own Test Case class
and
>> make the shared data instance variables. It will clean things up a
lot
>> and shorten the test names.
>
>Building test classes around the fixture is a good idea. However, I'm
not
>very comfortable with the names we have chosen for these classes so
far,
>since it is often difficult to find a descriptive way for the fixture
>itself. It's easier when the fixture somehow refers to a common
>functionality, eg. AccountTransferTest having two Account instances in
its
>fixture; but even here the exceptional case of transfering money from
one
>account to itself only uses one of the two instances.
>
>Any experiences/hints/suggestions with choosing names for fixture
based
>test
>classes?
>
>Johannes
>
>
